title: Can we stop trying to "fix" the tank meta?
body:
Really, besides a handful of offenders (lets be honest, when isn't there a broken champion somewhere in the game?), and the fact that they need to shift Cinderhulk's %HP to a normal item so that laners stop taking smite to get their hands on a decent tank item for once... (I'm not seeing infinity edge or deathcap being a smite-only item)

The tank meta is pretty balanced. In fact, it isn't even the "tank meta." This is legitimately just _the meta._ You're all just calling it the tank meta because its the first time tanks have seen play in a few seasons so you just forgot that they were even champions.

Without tanks in the meta, assassins and burst damage carries rule. Tanks can finally fit into the game again, so there is a counter to these types of champions, so that they can be **strong, but not overbearing due to the presence of their natural counter: something they can't burst.**

This also means that ADCs don't have to be crazy over-tuned with damage and mobility to compete with the burst damage champions, because ADCs already beat tanks as they are **sustained damage.**

The rock-paper-scissors of the game has been re-established, and while it may need some mild tuning, its probably the most healthy balance for the game:

Sustained damage > Tank
Tank > Burst damage
Burst damage > Sustained damage

> [{quoted}](name=Loken Stoneheart,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=r3Gib0Z3,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-04-19T23:17:11.740+0000)
> Really, besides a handful of offenders (lets be honest, when isn't there a broken champion somewhere in the game?), and the fact that they need to shift Cinderhulk's %HP to a normal item so that laners stop taking smite to get their hands on a decent tank item for once... (I'm not seeing infinity edge or deathcap being a smite-only item)

The %HP being on a jungle item is important because many tanks have laning phases that are so weak that they can only be played in the jungle. Top lane Sejuani/Nautilus/Amumu will get eaten alive by 99% of the top laners in any given meta. So naturally, when those champions don't have something that makes them playable in the jungle, then we see Lee/J4/Vi jungle like we did earlier this season. 

However, putting the %HP on an item that isn't available outside the jungle (and most importantly, ISN'T AVAILABLE WITH WARRIOR ENCHANTMENT) prevents the Warrior-enchantment rushing junglers from being "real" tanks. Not only did they take a damage item over a bulk item, their bulk items give them less bulk than the junglers who have committed to building full tank. Now full tank is defined as Cinderhulk/Randuins/Spirit Visage +25% HP as opposed to Randuins/Spirit Visage/Locket or some other reasonable equivalent. 

I bring this up in every Cinderhulk thread because people seem to understand that Cinderhulk is why tanks are strong, but are completely wrong about WHY Cinderhulk being a jungle item is so important. Since Cinderhulk and its %HP are a jungle item, the bruiser champions who, historically, have been able to have the best of both worlds in early game strength and late game bulk **must now CHOOSE whether they are going to be early game pubstompers or late game tanks**. 

We can see this phenomenon even better with the Smite top laners that have started showing up. Champions like Shyvana are giving up Flash (substantially reducing their early game safety) in order to take Smite, which doesn't help them at all outside of allowing them to eventually purchase Cinderhulk. The fact that we've created a situation where **bruisers are WILLINGLY SACRIFICING their early game in order to be tanks** instead of having tanks just be eternally outclassed by bruisers is incredible, and we shouldn't just kill that choice by taking the %HP to a non-jungle item. 

Basically, the reason Cinderhulk is smite-only is because it's the only way to compensate tanks for their substantially weaker early game compared to bruisers. If the bruisers don't take Cinderhulk, the tanks get an insurmountable late game bulk advantage; if the bruisers do take Cinderhulk, they lose substantial burst on their early ganks, essentially putting the tanks and bruisers on a level playing field. All of these advantages are lost if %HP appears on a non-jungle item.
I think the most important part of what you said has to do with the warrior enchantment. If vi or j4 could get warrior and still get bonus % health scaling I would cry every day.

Although they are starting with an item with 0 health.  It would take a while to get the bonus %health and even longer to get effective use out of it.

"Smite, which doesn't help them at all outside of allowing them to eventually purchase Cinderhulk" is actually not true though.  Challenging Smite is great in duels (as it was designed to be), and top lane is full of duels.  Smite doesn't help in the *really early* game, unless you're taking the meta changes all the way and double jungling, but as soon as you get that Sabre, you can already use it on your lane opponent.

Anyway, I think concern about bruisers snatching up % bonus HP is a bit overdone.  Any %HP item will always work better on a champion that is actually building multiple items with bonus HP on them.  Sure, there's a *little* bonus HP on triforce and cleaver, but building those with any %HP item isn't going to give near the results of Randuin's or BV/SV (or Sunfire, if you're assuming a non-jungler who is building some other %HP item instead of Cinderhulk itself).

I think the big thing is that a % bonus would normally make it a late game item (similar to why deathcap second or third is more common than first), but because it's a jungle upgrade and jungle upgrades *as a category* are so strong and useful, you actually want to rush it.  So 1 damage item, 2 other tank items, then %HP item is actually not that great a buildpath for Cinderhulk because you're delaying your other jungle power (and that burn) too long -- whereas it might be perfectly reasonable for a non-smite Shyv if you put %HP on something like Warmog's (swapping out some of its current flat HP).

IDK if it's really that horrible for a top laner to get a BOTRK/hydra/gunblade/triforce/etc. first and then build semi-tanky with a late game Warmog's, though.  They would have a long time of a lot less tankiness than a Cinderhulk rusher (or for that matter a full tank Warmog's rushing Mundo or something like that) before finally approaching the toughness of a true tank at 30+ minutes.

And since Warrior junglers would be rushing, well, Warrior, which gives 0 HP, a hypothetical %HP Warmog's wouldn't be at all an attractive second item for them either -- hitting real tankiness wouldn't start until at least the third item, and then they still have the problem of probably having 0 (well, their base amount) in at least one resist.  Something like {{item:3714}} {{item:3143}} {{item:3102}} {{item:3083}} on a jungler's income, you're probably looking at *at least* 30 min, during which you've been substantially less tanky than a real tank (although you have of course done more damage).

And even once they do have four full items with only one being damage, they're still nowhere near the tankiness of {{champion:113}} {{item:3717}} {{item:3143}} {{item:3102}} {{item:3075}}  or {{champion:36}} {{item:3083}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3143}} {{item:3068}} .

Tanks have consistently held the highest win rates in League - even before the introduction of Cinderhulk.

To say that their current state is _balance_ is an understatement. On LoL Statistics, the 7 out of the top 10 winning champions are tanks.
I am fine with tanks countering Assassins; however, with their current durability, they can seriously wound an ADC just by taking damage while doing absolutely nothing with the gromp buff and thorn mail.

If the ADC doesn't kite, a tank such as Amumu or Sejuani can easily beat them with their abilities as well.

As of now, tank can compete with any other archetype. They are a natural counter to assassins, they make ADCs kill themselves by hitting them, and they can out duel even fighters by taking Challenging Smite.

This is far worse than how the Assassin meta was at the end of season 4. At least you had a chance to kill these bastards if they messed up.

If magic damage is killing you, you can build a certain item to help you. It's like you don't want to not build in a cookiecutter pattern. Tanks mostly deal magic damage, so build magic resist, even if it means sacrificing a bit of ad, or as. Or don't focus the tank, like you're supposed to.

Without tanks, your whole team just gets melted before you can do damage, but without a team, a tank can't reasonably kill anyone unless they go bruiser. 

In the assassin meta, it's kill instantly or die instantly. Everyone has mobility so you can't catch shit. Your chance to kill them is the vanishingly small chance that a carry survived lethal burst and the assassin blew all their mobility, stealth, and flash without their team nearby. Whichever assassin was more fed usually meant whichever team wins.

That was true in season 4.
However, with the changes in S5, tanks have become significantly better at what they do.
In the level system rework, all champions have 168% of their base stats compared to season 4.

Along with the changes to Cinderhulk, which essentially is a Spirit of the Ancient Golem with sun fire cape built in, tanks are now much stronger than they were. Additionally, Challenging smite gives tanks a degree of dueling potential they have never had.

Even in the previous season, tanks were not particularly weak either. Rammus for example, had an absurdly high win rate (54%+) just because of how difficult it is to kill him. ADCs would literally die themselves first from trying to auto him.

Now with the introduction of the new Jungle, everyone can essentially get Rammus's defensive curl with Gromp. Hence, an overwhelming majority of the top win rate champions are tanks.

Building MR to counter tanks is a valid tactic; however, ultimately one should not have to build defensively just to fight someone else also building defense. This will lead to a cycle where tank items dominate everything else. 
For the record, when Talon and LB were dominating mid lane, people also said to "build armor/MR" to survive their burst.

Assassins were unkillable partially because of their abilities, but the player behind them must also be decent as well. Tanks are unkillable because of their items, and they can dish out some serious damage as well just by taking hits or being near you.

You forget that while tanks have new items, carries do too, botrk and liandrys.
Tanks were still far from viable in S4, you really only needed one to soak up damage and be a meatwall. They had an absurdly high winrate because nobody really liked playing them, and they were an essential part of every team that somehow got overlooked in favour of another assassin or bruiser. They also countered many assassins, which means that in an assassin meta, they are very strong.

Are you seriously suggesting that building properly is not smart? If you're a carry, you shouldn't even be dueling a tank. How hard is it to get cleaver and lw to negate 50% of a tank's armor, and merc treads and mercurials or wits to get enough mr with a touch of offence? I find it boggling how the introduction of one tank item makes all of them oppressive, when offensive items have dominated the meta since S3. Laning against a tank as a carry will never be a problem if cinderhulk is a jungle only item. You couldn't build defensively in lane because you had to farm.

Try playing a tank with making mistakes and you'll realize it's actually hard to stay alive if you aren't careful about when you engage.
